Description: Round-topped sandstone stela divided into three registers: 1 - Winged sun-disc with uraei and seated jackals below. 2 - Scene of Diocletian offering to the mummy of the Buchis Bull. 3 - Seven lines of Hieroglyphic text.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p. 37)
Mond & Myers 1934 / The Bucheum (2:18-19, 34, 52, pl. XLVI)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.52)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015-2016, Oct 29-Feb 7, London, BM, G35, Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs. 2022-2023 3 Sept-1 Jan, Norwich, Sainsbury Centre, Visions of Ancient Egypt (tour) 2023 28 Jan-29 Apr, Newcastle, Laing Art Gallery, Visions of Ancient Egypt (tour)
